page.title: 15VICTORIA WHARF DOCKS.
page.content: Situated to the west of the Cattewater and now a hundred years old, this{dock}was originally a quarry and was constructed out of granite by a team of Irish labourers who took eight years to finish it. 28 people now work at the dock which has 2 {warehouses}overing over 30000 square feet of ground. On average about 330 ships dock in each year. The main commodity is predictably {China Clay}which is a major export from the south west. The manager would prefer to have a larger capacity to accommodate the larger{ships}which can carry nearly 4000 tonnes. The dock has 28 lorries, 5 fork-lift trucks, 2 cranes, 10 conveyors and 1 locomotive. During the First and Second World Wars the dock was used as an American naval base.
